column4: hi there I am looking for some graphic editor tool apart from gimp and inkscape
I am looking for something like gimp
the problem with gimp is that shapes can be drawn and managed easily
qcad let me try
Why don't you just look in Synaptic under the Graphics tab?
photoshop
is there a linux version ?
something that is available for linux
dev files don't need lib
then against what will an c program be build ?
c programs only need header files
strange... you mean no need of function implementation ... only the names ?
The functions are implemented in the header files
sure ? I thought that header files only have the protoypes
by the way what are these .a and .la files ?
.a is a unix static object code library, la is a gnu libtol library file
so .a files shud have the pseudo code , .so files the real function implementation and .h files the prototype ?
What is the actual issue?
just trying to understand what has what
You may want to join ##c if it's not an ubuntu related issue
the topic is linux related
